verses.sanskrit:
देवराजसेव्यमानपावनाङ्घ्रिपङ्कजं व्यालयज्ञसूत्रमिन्दुशेखरं कृपाकरम्।
नारदादियोगिवृन्दवन्दितं दिगम्बरं काशिकापुराधिनाथकालभैरवं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
devarājasevyamānapāvanāṅghripaṅkajaṃ vyālayajñasūtramindus ekharaṃ kṛpākaram।
nāradādiyogivṛndavanditaṃ digambaraṃ kāśikāpurādhināthakal ābhairavaṃ bhaje॥
verses.meaning: I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, whose lotus feet are served by Indra the king of gods and are purifying, who wears serpents as sacred thread, who has the moon on his head, who is the embodiment of compassion, who is worshipped by Narada and hosts of yogis, and who is clad in the directions.

verses.sanskrit:
भानुकोटिभास्वरं भवाब्धितारकं परं नीलकण्ठमीप्सितार्थदायकं त्रिलोचनम्।
कालकालमम्बुजाक्षमक्षशूलमक्षरं काशिकापुराधिनाथकालभैरवं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
bhānukoṭibhāsvaraṃ bhavābdhitārakaṃ paraṃ nīlakaṇṭhamīpsitārthadāyakaṃ trilocanam।
kālakālamamb ujākṣamakṣaśūlamakṣaraṃ kāśikāpurādhināthakal ābhairavaṃ bhaje॥
verses.meaning: I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, who shines with the brilliance of millions of suns, who helps us cross the ocean of existence, who is supreme, who has a blue throat, who grants desired objects, who has three eyes, who is the death to the god of death, who has lotus-like eyes, whose trident is invincible, and who is imperishable.

verses.sanskrit:
शूलटङ्कपाशदण्डपाणिमादिकारणं श्यामकायमादिदेवमक्षरं निरामयम्।
भीमविक्रमं प्रभुं विचित्रताण्डवप्रियं काशिकापुराधिनाथकालभैरवं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
śūlaṭaṅkapāśadaṇḍapāṇimādikāraṇaṃ śyāmakāyamādidevamaakṣaraṃ nirāmayam।
bhīmavikramaṃ prabhuṃ vicitrataāṇḍavapriyaṃ kāśikāpurādhināthakal ābhairavaṃ bhaje॥
verses.meaning: I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, who holds trident, mattock, noose and club in his hands, who is the primordial cause, who has a dark body, who is the primal god, who is imperishable, who is free from disease, who is immensely powerful, the lord who loves the wonderful Tandava dance.

verses.sanskrit:
भुक्तिमुक्तिदायकं प्रशस्तचारुविग्रहं भक्तवत्सलं स्थिरं समस्तलोकविग्रहम्।
निर्मलादिभूषणं जरारुजादिवर्जितं काशिकापुराधिनाथकालभैरवं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
bhuktimuktidāyakaṃ praśastacaruvigrahaṃ bhaktavatsalaṃ sthiraṃ samastalokavi graham।
nirmalādibhūṣaṇaṃ jarārujādivarjitaṃ kāśikāpurādhināthakal ābhairavaṃ bhaje॥
verses.meaning: I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, who grants both worldly pleasures and liberation, who has a beautiful and auspicious form, who is devoted to his devotees, who is steadfast, who is the form of all worlds, who is adorned with pure ornaments, and who is free from old age and disease.

verses.sanskrit:
धर्मसेतुपालकं त्वधर्ममार्गनाशकं कर्मपाशमोचकं सुशर्मदायकं विभुम्।
स्वर्णवर्णकेशपाशशोभितङ्गमण्डलं काशिकापुराधिनाथकालभैरवं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
dharmasetupālakaṃ tvadhar mamārganāśakaṃ karmapāśamocakaṃ suśarmadāyakaṃ vibhum।
svarṇavarṇakeśapāśaśobhitaṅgamaṇḍalaṃ kāśikāpurādhināthakal ābhairavaṃ bhaje॥
verses.meaning: I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, who upholds the bridge of dharma, who destroys the path of unrighteousness, who liberates from the bonds of karma, who grants great happiness, who is omnipresent, whose body is beautified by serpents with golden-hued hoods.

verses.sanskrit:
रत्नपादुकाप्रभाभिरामपादयुग्मकं नित्यमद्वितीयमिष्टदैवतं निरञ्जनम्।
मृत्युदर्पनाशनं करालदंष्ट्रमोक्षणं काशिकापुराधिनाथकालभैरवं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
ratnapādukāprabhābhirāmapādayugmakaṃ nityamadvitīyamiṣṭadaivataṃ nirañjanam।
mṛtyudarpa nāśanaṃ karāladaṃṣṭramoakṣaṇaṃ kāśikāpurādhināthakal ābhairavaṃ bhaje॥
verses.meaning: I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, whose pair of feet shine beautifully with gem-studded sandals, who is eternal and non-dual, who is the beloved deity, who is untainted, who destroys the pride of death, and who grants liberation through his fearsome teeth.

I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, whose loud laughter destroys the sheaths of Brahma's creation, whose glance destroys the web of sins, who is the fierce ruler, who grants the eight siddhis (supernatural powers), and who wears a garland of skulls.

verses.sanskrit:
भूतसङ्घनायकं विशालकीर्तिदायकं काशिवासलोकपुण्यपापशोधकं विभुम्।
नीतिमार्गकोविदं पुरातनं जगत्पतिं काशिकापुराधिनाथकालभैरवं भजे॥
verses.transliteration:
bhūtasaṅghanāyakaṃ viśālakīrtidāyakaṃ kāśivāsalokapuṇyapāpaśodhakaṃ vibhum।
nītimārgakovidaṃ purātanaṃ jagatpatiṃ kāśikāpurādhināthakal ābhairavaṃ bhaje॥
verses.meaning: I worship Lord Kalabhairava, the supreme lord of Kashi, who is the leader of spirits and ghosts, who grants vast fame, who purifies the people of Kashi from their merits and sins, who is omnipresent, who is well-versed in the path of righteousness, who is ancient, and who is the lord of the universe.

verses.sanskrit:
कालभैरवाष्टकं पठन्ति ये मनोहरं ज्ञानमुक्तिसाधनं विचित्रपुण्यवर्धनम्।
शोकमोहदैन्यलोभकोपतापनाशनं ते प्रयान्ति कालभैरवाङ्घ्रिसन्निधिं ध्रुवम्॥
verses.transliteration:
kālabhairavāṣṭakaṃ paṭhanti ye manoharam jñānamuktisādhanaṃ vicitrapuṇyavardhanam।
śokamoh adainyalobhakopatāpanāśanaṃ te prayānti kālabhairavāṅghrisannidhiṃ dhruvam॥
verses.meaning: Those who recite this beautiful Kalabhairava Ashtakam, which is the means to knowledge and liberation, which increases various virtues, and which destroys grief, delusion, poverty, greed, anger and anguish - they surely attain the holy feet of Lord Kalabhairava.
